07.title: In My Heart
description: ‚Ä¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Baptiste "Oacke" Simon
‚Ä¢ Used VSTs & Samples: AUVM10_Acapella3_Full_Wet_125_Bm.wav on Splice (vocals)

‚Ä¢ About this track: Happy Hardcore is the genre that got me into electronic music by listening to artists like S3RL or Darren Styles. If my main genre under my main project is usually drum & bass, I wanted to go back to my "roots" with a new alias, Oacke. "In My Heart" is one of the debut releases, highly influenced by mid-2000s Happy and UK Hardcore, with a joyful melody and powerful synths.

11.title: Kawaii Yourself
description: ‚Ä¢ Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)
‚Ä¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Text to Speech

‚Ä¢ About this track: This track, coincidentally beginning production on world suicide prevention day, is about investing in yourself as a means of fighting suicidal thoughts. It subverts the meaning of the phrase "kys", and uses the theming of kawaii, like a magical girl transition, to instead tell you to "become the one you were "meant to be", and that you are "absolutely deserving of love". The tone of the track resembles mania and conflict, the kind of feelings relevant when needing reassurance and direction to focus back on your values. Every positive upbeat message is paired with harsh bass and drums, conflicting sounds, sudden transitions in tone. Kawaii Yourself (verb) - Become the one you were always meant to be.

12.title: PRESS RESTART
description: ‚Ä¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Casio Lamb (KodamaSounds)
‚Ä¢ Mastering Engineer: Clipping, Limiting, Sustrative EQ
‚Ä¢ Used VSTs & Samples: "Ethereal Vocals" (Sample Tools by CR2)

‚Ä¢ About this track: PRESS RESTART is my first step into tech genres. MEGAREX has consistently put out works that I greatly admire and cherish, with FUGENE and Techcore Evangelix being some of my favourites -- so I thought I'd give it a shot! While I don't believe it meets the same standards, I am proud of how it turned out and hope others are too. During production I chose to do it all by ear, I had heard many lapix, Mameyudoufu, PSYQUI, and Srav3R tracks over and over again and used them as inspiration. Towards the end I got inspired to add a little bit of artcore/breaks because I found myself listening to a lot of Mili over the week, too.

04.title: dauntless
description: ‚Ä¢ Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)

‚Ä¢ About this track: This track has existed in some form or another for two years now. I first produced it in 2023, when I was just beginning to cut my teeth on the trance genre. I was looking to submit it to hypertrance, but something stopped me from doing so. Then, earlier this year, I revisited the project for ECLECTIC RESONANCE Escapism, but the song didn't fit into the overall hopeful mood of the album. Finally, as the deadline for ECLECTIC RESONANCE UPRISING 3 drew near, I gave the track one last shot, and third time was the charm. Though the project file itself wasn't the easiest to work with, my ideas from 2 years ago were surprisingly still compelling to me - I think it builds a great spaciousness, and the arps and gated chords sound divine. I'm happy to release this track at last.

05.title: The Headliner
description: ‚Ä¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by vervid!

‚Ä¢ About this track: hi again. it's vervid. this song has been in the works for as long as i can remember, and i'm so happy that i managed to get it done. for this song, i go under the alias "Hybrid Anomaly", which are reserved for more heavier, non-breakcore genres and styles - such as this track right here. "The Headliner" is my definition of a 'hype' song whilst also being my first genuine attempt in making UK hardcore (fused with some breakbeats here and there). hope you guys enjoy this one!

15.title: Sorrow & Demise
description: ‚Ä¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by PSYQUO, Volumetrique (KodamaSounds)
‚Ä¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Brainstorm (1983) Vocal Sample

PSYQUO: Hi, it's PSYQUO. This time collabing with Volumetrique, we made a Tech DnB track. For the concept I had while making parts of the track - the song reflects the many things we see in the world. This sadness and hopeless is what many of us are feeling right now. I hope these feelings come through the song. As for the collab, I originally approached Volumetrique to make a Schranz track, but after a bit of  back and forth, we decided to do DnB instead. (Schranz collab when) A big thank you to Volumetrique for making the track whole!

Volumetrique: Dan here. I've finally had the opportunity of releasing a track as Volumetrique on KodamaSounds... And it's a Tech DnB banger with feelings‚Ñ¢, inspired by the likes of IMANU, The Caracal Project, C&K... With the massive help and gorgeous sound design skills of PSYQUO, we've cooked a snappy, tech-neurofunk-ish track. You won't find any snappier drums anywhere else at M3 ;) ( ok, maybe at Supire's :P ). I've been immensely carried by PSYQUO, who also initiated the collab and I'm deeply thankful for the opportunity, through the highs and the lows. We ended up crunching hard to finish this~! And about that Schranz collab... maybe we'll get to start it in Japan together ;;) Enjoy!!! üôá‚ö°üöµ
